data.heading: Scope
data.text:
The management of electronic transport regulations (METR) [SOURCE: ISO 24315-1:2024, 3.3.2.3] provides trustworthy, authoritative, machine-interpretable, transport-related rules for using the road network.

The scope of METR includes both rules that are relatively static (e.g., static speed limits) as well as those that are dynamic (e.g., variable speed limits, lane closures at incident scenes). However, where appropriate, METR is expected to incorporate existing standards (e.g., ISO/TS 19091 for signalized intersections).

The scope of METR includes the networks for pedestrians, public-area mobile robots (PMRs), micromobility vehicles, and motor vehicles.

This document defines the requirements for a METR component system that is responsible for receiving discrepancy reports from METR user systems and providing consolidated, anonymized reports to METR translation systems for further investigation as appropriate. This document is presented in a format that is consistent with the guidance provided by ISO 29148 [2] for a system requirements document. 

For an understanding of how the METR discrepancy handling system fits into the larger METR system of systems, see ISO 24315-3. The operational concept for METR is provided in ISO 24315-2.

attributesChanged.text:
The management of electronic transport regulations (METR) provides trustworthy, authoritative, machine-interpretable, transport-related rules for using surface transport facilities.

The scope of METR includes both rules that are relatively static (e.g., static speed limits) as well as those that are dynamic (e.g., variable speed limits, lane closures at incident scenes). However, where appropriate, METR is expected to incorporate existing standards (e.g., ISO/TS 19091 for signalized intersections).

This document defines the system requirements for a METR discrepancy handling system in a format that is consistent with the guidance provided by ISO 29148 [2] for a system requirements document. 

For an understanding of how the METR distribution system fits into the larger METR system of systems, see ISO 24315-2. The operational concept for METR is provided in ISO 24315-1.

** Editor's Note: This draft document is generated from a requirements management tool. Headings within the draft document include a reference within square brackets (e.g., "[SoSR-35]") that indicate the source location of the text to assist in maintaining the text. These references will be removed in the final text. Text demarked with double asterisks ("**") are editorial notes that will be removed from the final draft. **

data.heading: Normative references
data.text: The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some, or all, of their content constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies.

children.text: ISO/TS 14812, Intelligent transport systems — Vocabulary
ISO/TS 24315-1, Intelligent transport systems — Management of electronic traffic regulations (METR) — Part 1: Vocabulary
ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, Systems and software engineering — Vocabulary

data.heading: Terms and definitions
data.text:
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, ISO/TS 14812, ISO 24315-1, and the following apply.

ISO and IEC maintain terminology databases for use in standardization at the following addresses:

•   ISO Online browsing platform: available at https://www.iso.org/obp

•   IEC Electropedia: available at https://www.electropedia.org

children.heading: General
children.text: Figure 1 identifies the incoming and outgoing information flows for a METR regulation system per the reference architecture, which is defined in full in Clause 8 of the SoSR (ISO 24315-3).

children.heading: MDHS information flows
children.text: The MRS-related information transfers (i.e., source, destination, and information flow) identified in the figure include the following, which are defined in detail in Clause 6:
MDC -> MDHC: METR information
MDHC -> MRC: consolidated discrepancy report
MDHC -> MRC: discrepancy report details
MDHC <-> Other MDHC: consolidated discrepancy report
MDHC <-> Other MDHC: discrepancy report details
MDHC <-> Other MDHC: discrepancy suppression info
METR user device -> MDHC: METR discrepancy report
MRC -> MDHC: discrepancy suppression info
MRC -> MDHC: METR information

children.heading: Log reports
children.text: Upon receipt of a consolidated discrepancy report, the discrepancy handler system shall retain each received report as required per local policies.

attributesChanged.text:
Upon receipt of a discrepancy report, the discrepancy handler system shall retain each received discrepancy report as required per local policies.

NOTE: At a minimum, it is expected that discrepancy handling systems will retain reports long enough to detect trends. Local policies can require longer periods of retention to support legal and other requirements.

children.heading: Discrepancy report management
children.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall track the discrepancy reports by their fingerprints.

attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall track the discrepancy reports received with an identical discrepancy report fingerprint, which includes the following elements:

children.heading: Generate consolidation report
children.text: The discrepancy handler system shall generate a consolidated discrepancy report based on the received discrepancy fingerprints and associated information when criteria are met.

attributesChanged.text:
The discrepancy handler system shall generate a consolidated discrepancy report of the received reports when criteria are met.

NOTE: The defined criteria are based on local policies, such as a percentage of vehicles reporting the discrepancy, inspection of supplied electronic information (e.g., photographs), field site visits, etc.

The discrepancy handler system shall generate a consolidated discrepancy report of the received reports when criteria are met.

NOTE 1: The defined criteria are based on local policies, such as a percentage of vehicles reporting the discrepancy, inspection of supplied electronic information (e.g., photographs), field site visits, etc.

NOTE 2: The defined criteria for the collecting discrepancy handler can be different than the criteria established for the contributing discrepancy handlers.

children.heading: Information flow: Discrepancy report details
children.text: As needed to investigate and resolve discrepancies, the METR discrepancy handling system shall obtain discrepancy report details from the reporting discrepancy handling system.

attributesChanged.text: Allows translation system to suppress and release suppression of discrepancies by full or partial fingerprint

Allows translation system to suppress and release suppression of discrepancies by full or partial fingerprint; when suppression is released for a discrepancy fingerprint, its associated counters shall be released.

The discrepancy handler system shall revise its list of suppressed consolidated discrepancy reports based on the criteria specified, which can include


Allows translation system to suppress and release suppression of discrepancies by full or partial fingerprint; when suppression is released for a discrepancy fingerprint, its associated counters shall be released. 


1. Suppress reports for METR info item (perhaps with discrepancy type) from any logic system (i.e., another source has told me, I don't need additional notices)

2. Suppress reports for METR info item (perhaps with discrepancy type) from any release of a logic system prior to a specific release number  (i.e., error is on the discrepancy reporter's end)

3. Cancel suppression (i.e., error was fixed on translator side)

Allows translation system to suppress and release suppression of discrepancies by full or partial fingerprint; when suppression is released for a discrepancy fingerprint, its associated counters shall be released. 


1. Suppress reports for METR info item (perhaps with discrepancy type) from any logic system (i.e., another source has told me, I don't need additional notices)

2. Suppress reports for METR info item (perhaps with discrepancy type) from any release of a logic system prior to a specific release number  (i.e., error is on the discrepancy reporter's end)

3. Cancel suppression (i.e., error was fixed on translator side)

NOTE: There are three main examples of where this flow is used:

  1. Suppress reports for a METR information item (perhaps with a specific discrepancy type) from any logic system.
  2. Suppress reports for a METR information item (perhaps with a specific discrepancy type) from any release of a logic system prior to a specific release number  (i.e., to filter out reports from an old software version).
  3. To allow reports that were previously cancelled (e.g., after an error in a METR information item was fixed on translator side).

children.heading: General
children.text:
There are three main examples of where this flow is used:

  1. Suppress reports for a METR information item (perhaps with a specific discrepancy type) from any logic system.
  2. Suppress reports for a METR information item (perhaps with a specific discrepancy type) from any release of a logic system prior to a specific release number  (i.e., to filter out reports from an old software version).
  3. To allow reports that were previously cancelled (e.g., after an error in a METR information item was fixed on translator side).

children.heading: Maintain suppression list
children.text: The discrepancy handler system shall revise its list of suppressed consolidated discrepancy reports based on the criteria specified, which shall include:

children.title: Suppression cancellation

children.heading: Cancel suppression
children.text: Upon the cancellation of a suppression entry, the METR discrepancy handler system shall clear all report information associated with the indicated discrepancy.

attributesChanged.text: Upon the cancellation of a suppression entry, the METR discrepancy handler system shall clear all report information associated with the indicated discrepancy, including:

Upon the cancellation of a suppression entry, the METR discrepancy handler system shall clear all report information associated with the indicated discrepancy.

NOTE: This allows a new consolidated report to be generated without referencing old data that might prove misleading.

children.text: The discrepancy handler system shall generate a consolidated discrepancy report of the received reports when criteria are met.

attributesChanged.text:
The discrepancy handling functional object shall verify the reported inconsistency.

NOTE: The verification process is based on local policies and can include tasks such as comparing the percentage of vehicles reporting the discrepancy, inspection of supplied electronic information (e.g., photographs), field site visits, etc.

attributesChanged.text:

NOTE: The verification process is based on local policies and can include tasks such as comparing the percentage of vehicles reporting the discrepancy, inspection of supplied electronic information (e.g., photographs), field site visits, etc.

The discrepancy handler system shall track the number of reports perform verification checks on each reported inconsistency.

children.heading: General
children.text: For each relevant translation system, the METR discrepancy handler system shall update the following within the ruleTranslationUpdateInterval:

children.text: the relevant rules;
the boundaries of each relevant sub-area; and

children.heading: Verify information (from distribution systems)
children.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall perform verification checks on the received rules.

attributesChanged.heading: Verify information

children.heading: Log detected inconsistencies
children.text: The METR user system shall log any discrepancies discovered and resultant actions taken.

children.heading: Information flow: Component status
children.text: The METR discrepancy handling system shall make its configuration and operational status available to authorized external systems.

attributesChanged.text: As needed, the METR distribution system shall provide its configuration and operational status to authorized external systems.
As needed, the METR discrepancy handling system shall provide its configuration and operational status to authorized external systems.

attributesChanged.heading: Monitor services
attributesChanged.text:
As needed, the METR discrepancy handling system shall provide its configuration and operational status to authorized external systems.

EXAMPLE  A translator can monitor the status of a discrepancy reporter to ensure that it is receiving reports.

The METR discrepancy handling system shall make its configuration and operational status available to authorized external systems.

EXAMPLE  A translator can monitor the status of a discrepancy handling system to ensure that it is receiving reports.

The METR discrepancy handling system shall make its configuration and operational status available to authorized external systems.

EXAMPLE  A Service Monitor System can monitor the status of a discrepancy handling system to ensure that it is issuing discrepancy reports.

children.text: A Service Monitor System can monitor the status of a discrepancy handling system to ensure that it is issuing discrepancy reports.

children.heading: Log discrepancy report
children.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall log each consolidated discrepancy report it generates.

attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy system shall log discrepancy reports and track the number of reports received
The METR discrepancy system shall log each discrepancy report it receives.
The METR discrepancy handler system shall log each consolidated discrepancy report it transmits.

children.heading: Relay discrepancy report
children.text: Unless the discrepancy is currently suppressed, the METR discrepancy handler system shall send the consolidated discrepancy report to the report receiver(s) for the relevant translator(s).

attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall report discrepancies originating from other sources once they pass verification checks.

The METR discrepancy handler system shall report discrepancies originating from other sources once the  existence of the discrepancy has been deemed credible for investigation by the translation system.

NOTE: The method by which credibility is determined is locally defined.

The METR discrepancy handler system shall report discrepancies reported by user systems once the  existence of the discrepancy has been deemed credible for further investigation.

NOTE: The method by which credibility is determined is locally defined.

The METR discrepancy handler system shall send a consolidated discrepancy report to configured systems once the existence of the discrepancy has been deemed credible for further investigation.

NOTE: The method by which credibility is determined can be locally or regionally defined.

Unless the discrepancy is currently suppressed, the METR discrepancy handler system shall send the consolidated discrepancy report to the report receiver(s) for the relevant translator(s).

NOTE: The report receiver for a translator is envisioned to be the translator itself or a regional discrepancy handler system. 

EXAMPLE  An OEM-based discrepancy handler reports to a regional discrepancy handler system which then reports to a specific translator system

children.heading: Suppress discrepancy report
children.text: After sending a consolidated discrepancy report, the discrepancy handler system shall add each discrepancy fingerprint included in the consolidated discrepancy report to its discrepancy suppression list.

attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall suppress the transmission of any consolidated discrepancy report
After sending a consolidated discrepancy report, the discrepancy handler system shall add the

After sending a consolidated discrepancy report, the discrepancy handler system shall add each discrepancy fingerprint included in the consolidated discrepancy report to its discrepancy suppression list.

After sending a consolidated discrepancy report, the discrepancy handler system shall add each discrepancy fingerprint included in the consolidated discrepancy report to its discrepancy suppression list.

NOTE: The system will continue to log all received discrepancies and will maintain the counters until the discrepancy report fingerprint is removed from the discrepancy suppression list.

NOTE 1: The discrepancy handler system will continue to log all received discrepancies and will maintain the counters until the discrepancy report fingerprint is removed from the discrepancy suppression list.

children.text: The discrepancy handler system will continue to log all received discrepancies and will maintain the counters until the discrepancy report fingerprint is removed from the discrepancy suppression list.

children.heading: Information flow: Discrepancy report details
children.text: The discrepancy handler system shall provide complete details of each discrepancy report that meets the criteria defined in an authorized request.

children.heading: Information flow: Object registration
children.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall register the following information with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall register its network address, service offerings and metrics characterizing those services with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

The METR discrepancy handling system shall register its network address, service offerings and metrics characterizing those services with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

attributesChanged.heading: Register with ITS discovery service
attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy handling system shall register its network address, service offerings (e.g., which road ) and metrics characterizing those services with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

The METR discrepancy handler system shall register the following information with a discovery service such that METR user systems can determine if the services are relevant to their needs.

its network address, service offerings (e.g., which road ) and metrics characterizing those services

transport network(s) supported (e.g., motor vehicle road network)

discussion.comment: Is this needed or would it be better to have a single discrepancy system for all networks so that cross-network discrepancies can be detected?

children.heading: Report self-detected discrepancies
children.text: The METR discrepancy handling system shall report discrepancies detected based on its own verification checks on received rule information.

children.heading: Logging discrepancy reports
children.text: The METR discrepancy system shall log each discrepancy detected based on its own verification checks.

attributesChanged.text: The METR discrepancy system shall log each discrepancy report it receives.

children.heading: Relaying discrepancy
children.text:
The METR discrepancy handler system shall send a system-generated discrepancy report to each translation system associated with each METR information item for which a discrepancy has been detected.


** The discrepancy report will list the discrepancy fingerprint (i.e., the METR information item id, the error type, the software identifier for the verification detection, and its release date).  **

attributesChanged.text:
Unless the discrepancy is currently suppressed, the METR discrepancy handler system shall send a consolidated discrepancy report to configured systems once the existence of the discrepancy has been deemed credible for further investigation.

NOTE: The method by which credibility is determined can be locally or regionally defined.


**** The consolidated discrepancy report will list all relevant fingerprints and count information (e.g., raw count, current rate, etc) for each; this will include any suppressed fingerprints with updated count information.

The METR discrepancy handler system shall send a system-generated discrepancy report to configured systems for each discrepancy detected based on its own verification checks.

NOTE: The system does not suppress system-generated discrepancy reports. If the system receives an update of METR information containing the same verification error, it will generate a new discrepancy report.


**** The discrepancy report will list the discrepancy fingerprint (i.e., with the software and developer information of the discrepancy handler information).

The METR discrepancy handler system shall send a system-generated discrepancy report to each translation system associated with each METR information item for which a discrepancy has been detected.

NOTE: The system does not suppress system-generated discrepancy reports. If the system receives an update of METR information containing the same verification error, it will generate a new discrepancy report.


**** The discrepancy report will list the discrepancy fingerprint (i.e., the METR information item id, the error type, the software identifier for the verification detection, and its release date).

children.text: The system does not suppress system-generated discrepancy reports. If the system receives an update of METR information containing the same verification error, it will generate a new discrepancy report.

children.heading: Information flow: Information verification
children.text: The METR discrepancy handler system shall perform verification checks on the collected information, including:

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall perform verification checks on the collected information, including:

children.text: verifying that each rule does not create any potential inconsistency issue (e.g., with any vocabulary term or other known rule);
children.title: Rule inconsistency

children.text: verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not create any potential inconsistency issue (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);
children.title: Term inconsistency

children.text: verifying that the boundaries of defined areas do not create any inconsistency;
children.title: Boundary inconsistency

children.text: verifying that terminated rules have been removed;
children.title: Terminated rule

children.text: verifying that any duplicate rules are removed;
children.title: Duplicate rule

children.text: verifying that old versions of updated rules (i.e., with the same identifier) are removed;
children.title: Updated rule

children.heading: Consolidate received reports
children.text: Upon verification of a discrepancy, the discrepancy handler system shall summarize all received reports about the discrepancy into a consolidated discrepancy report.

children.heading: Notify translation systems
children.text: Upon generation of the consolidated discrepancy report, the discrepancy handling system shall provide the report to the translator(s) associated with the electronic rule(s).

attributesChanged.text: Upon verification of a discrepancy, the discrepancy handler system shall determine the contact information for the translator(s) responsible for the associated electronic rule(s).

children.heading: Maintain awareness of translators
children.text: It is the responsibility of the discrepancy handling system operators to maintain contact information for translators.

attributesChanged.text: Upon verification of a discrepancy, the discrepancy handler system shall determine the contact information for the translator(s) responsible for the associated electronic rule(s).
